page.title: 02Changes - effect of Motorway
page.content: When we first came to Kemsing in 1957 it was a sleepy village with one bus an hour and the threat to the Dartford Tunnel and the M25 which was to be routed beyond the stream and between the Oast Houses and our woods. When the tunnel was built many more cars came onto the roads and in Otford village the transporters started trying to negotiate the small village pond. Next came the {Sevenoaks by-pass} at the top of Polehill. This was planned take away the village traffic. It didn't, and village life altered as the traffic increased. It was no longer safe to push prams along the narrow pavements, and eventually heavy traffic was banned from the village High Street but not at the pond. The use of country footpaths is the only way we can get away from the traffic. We hope the nearly completed M25 will help.
